Package camzup.core

Class Gradient

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Gradient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<Gradient.Key>
public class Gradient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Gradient.Key>, java.io.Serializable
A mutable, extensible class that contains a list of keys which hold colors at steps in the range [0.0, 1.0]. Allows smooth color transitions to be evaluated for a factor.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Gradient.Key
    A color key which stores a color at a given step (or percent).

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Gradient.Key> keys
    The list of color keys.
    static float TOLERANCE
    The tolerance used when determining whether the gradient contains duplicate keys.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Gradient()
    Creates a gradient with two default color keys, clear black at 0.0 and opaque white at 1.0.
    Gradient​(int color)
    Creates a gradient from a color integer; an additional color key, white at 0.0, is created.
    Gradient​(int... colors)
    Creates a gradient from a list of color integers; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
    Gradient​(Color color)
    Creates a gradient from a color; an additional color key, white at 0.0, is created.
    Gradient​(Color... colors)
    Creates a gradient from a list of colors; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
    Gradient​(Gradient.Key... keys)
    Creates a gradient from color keys.
    Gradient​(java.lang.String color)
    Creates a gradient from a color string; an additional color key, white at 0.0, is created.
    Gradient​(java.lang.String... colors)
    Creates a gradient from a list of color strings; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].

  • Field Details

    • TOLERANCE

      public static float TOLERANCE
      The tolerance used when determining whether the gradient contains duplicate keys.

    • keys

      public final java.util.ArrayList<Gradient.Key> keys
      The list of color keys. Initialized with a capacity of 8.

      public static Gradient paletteMagma​(Gradient target)

      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteRgb

      public static Gradient paletteRgb​(Gradient target)
      Returns seven primary and secondary colors: red, yellow, green, cyan, blue, magenta and red. Red is repeated so the gradient is periodic.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient
      See Also:
      Color.red(Color), Color.yellow(Color), Color.green(Color), Color.cyan(Color), Color.blue(Color), Color.magenta(Color)

    • paletteViridis

      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • reset

      public Gradient reset()
      Resets this gradient to an initial state, with two color keys, clear black at 0.0 and opaque white at 1.0 .
      Returns:
      this gradient
      See Also:
      Color.clearBlack(Color), Color.white(Color)

    • reverse

      public Gradient reverse()
      Reverses this gradient's order. Each key's step is subtracted from 1.0 .
      Returns:
      this gradient
